content: #24561 changes a lot of definitions from computable to noncomputable, and contains no explanation in its commit message. Is it possible for curious users who are not into the core development loop to have explanations about what changed that makes this necessary?

I believe they are discussed here https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/428973-nightly-testing/topic/.2323806.20adaptations.20for.20nightly-2025-04-07/with/510833106

By the way, itâ€™s true that the changes are not mentioned in the final commit message, but I found the Zulip thread by skimming through the individual commits, which each have their own associated PRs.
Thanks! It would be nice if these auto-merged commits could have more informative messages, but I guess skimming the individual commits will be my strategy next time.
Robin Carlier has marked this topic as resolved.
